intro: Tephrosia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Tephrosia paradoxa is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic applications.
